tutorial.text: Welcome to `Mountain Guarder`! Would you like to take a tutorial? (Left click to select answer)
As with most other games, use WASD to move, bla bla bla, insert generic how-to-play here.

Anyways, on the top right of your screen there is a `Menu` button. Click on that, it contains buttons to your `inventory` (I), `map` (M), and `settings`. Check out the `keybinds section` in your settings for more keybinds.

Open your `inventory` (E) and equip your `Wooden Bow` by clicking it and moving your mouse (the bow should follow it) and clicking again to release it over the left bow-shaped icon in the `Equips` section. Your character should be holding a bow now.
Now head down and talk to Stronk; right click on an NPC- I mean person to interact with them.

tutorial2.text: You will encounter Monsters of many kinds... Two years ago a swarm of Monsters invaded the Blu mine and killed everyone in it! Maybe you can help reclaim the Montan from those savages!
Have a shot at killing some Monsters, see if you like it.

tutorial3.text: `Left click` to use the item equipped (you can hold left click too). Just point your bow in that direction and click!

tutorial4.text: Nice, you didn't die. Off you go! Have fun, don't die!
Have a shot at killing some Monsters, see if you like it.

bob1.text: Hello! I'm Bob, nice to meet you! Welcome to the Snowy Outpost!
Yonder east is the Montan. Weird things have been happening since the Monsters took over. Everybody that has gone to find out has disappeared without a trace.

The Monsters? Those damn blobby things are the bane of our existence! They're bent on destroying every bit of civilization on the Montan, a few years ago they collapsed the mines! Since then the Blu trade has collapsed and the economy is in shambles.
You should go kill some, you'll get your money's worth for it. Maybe you'll even get some loot. The best monster conquerers are practically gods.
Okay then. Try not to die out there, okay?

bob3.text: Wow! You actually did it without dying! Last week someone named Spuh tried to hunt blobs and I haven't seen them since.

adicyte.text: Welcome to the Outpost Trader! What can I do for you?

tammy1.text: I don't think you're supposed to be here, but I have to tell you something...
As you probably know, strange things are happening more often now. Recently, our Lodestone went missing. We definitely didn't misplace it, but who would want to steal it? There's nobody here!
Also, strange glowing lights started coming from something a little bit higher up the mountain from the entrance of the old mineshaft after the Lodestone was stolen. I think it's connected somehow.
Can you go over there and investigate? It would REALLY help.
Thank you so much! Head east up the mountain, a bit further than the abandoned mineshaft. Try and figure out what's going on. Oh! Try to bring back the Lodestone if you find it!

tammy2.text: Head east past the abandoned mineshaft. That's where the strange stuff is happening.

options.text: I saw this really big rock. It was purple and tried to kill me! I think that's where the Lodestone is, something feels off.

tammy3.text: Then go and get the Lodestone! If the wrong entities get it things will go bad really fast!

tammy4.text: Thank you so much!!! You brought back the Lodestone! I can't put into words how important it is to have it back here safe again.

Oh right. I didn't tell you. Lodestone is extremely difficult to obtain - it's made from ultra-rare forms of Blu and Ialite. One small Lodestone crystal can hold the power of hundreds of thousands Ialite crystals.
You can probably see why it's so important that no evil gets their dirty hands on this. Imagine what horrors could happen if someone exploited it for their own selfish purposes!
Actually, keep the Lodestone. It'll probably be of more use to you, and it's the least I can do to thank you.

specialevent.text: Happy New Year!!!!! Don't worry, I won't kill you this time.
Anyways, here's a firework launcher, so you can celebrate the new year. I know it's a little past the start of the year, but you can use it to celebrate other things, too.
Off you go! Have a great day!
